page.title: 10HEALTH BEULAH - Garth
page.content: Under Powys Health Authority. Four GPs at Builth and one at Llanwrtyd. Daily surgeries in both places. Community care given by community nurses who visit sick and infirm at home, helping relatives to care for them. Maternity and child welfare clinics at Builth and Llanwrtyd. Chiropody for old age pensioners at each place also. Community hospital at Builth (approx 30 beds) caters mainly for maternity, non-surgical and convalescent cases. Long term geriatric cases usually sent to Llandrindod Unit. More serious and surgical cases sent to District General Hospitals at Hereford or Abergaveny, certain very serious cases possibly to Birmingham or Cheltenham. Mental patients referred to clinic at Llandrindod, and in-patient care at Mid Wales Hospital, Talgarth.
